full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 499-2 Filed 11/23/21 Page 18 of 159
LBAAMAX1ps
Rocchio - Direct
1 Q. As a clinical psychologist, what issues or areas have you specialized in?
2 A. Earlier in my career, as I said, I specialized in the assessment and treatment of eating disorders, and throughout my career I've specialized in the area of traumatic stress and interpersonal violence.
3 Q. Since about when have you focused on traumatic stress and interpersonal violence?
4 A. Since graduate school.
5 Q. In the course of your career, have you treated and evaluated individuals who have experienced or reported experiencing childhood sexual abuse?
6 A. I have.
7 Q. What is childhood sexual abuse?
8 A. "Childhood sexual abuse" refers to a process by which a child is involved, engaged in sexual activity by an adult or sometimes by a peer who's generally three to five years older than them, but it involves engaging the child in sexual activity when they either do not consent or are unable to consent.
9 Q. And when you refer to "child," what are you referring to?
10 A. Under the age of 18.
11 Q. Approximately how many victims of childhood sexual abuse have you evaluated and treated in your career?
12 A. I've treated hundreds upon hundreds of individuals who have
SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C.
(212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00007886

1 Q. As a clinical psychologist, what issues or areas have you specialized in?
2 A. Earlier in my career, as I said, I specialized in the assessment and treatment of eating disorders, and throughout my career I've specialized in the area of traumatic stress and interpersonal violence.
3 Q. Since about when have you focused on traumatic stress and interpersonal violence?
4 A. Since graduate school.
5 Q. In the course of your career, have you treated and evaluated individuals who have experienced or reported experiencing childhood sexual abuse?
6 A. I have.
7 Q. What is childhood sexual abuse?
8 A. "Childhood sexual abuse" refers to a process by which a child is involved, engaged in sexual activity by an adult or sometimes by a peer who's generally three to five years older than them, but it involves engaging the child in sexual activity when they either do not consent or are unable to consent.
9 Q. And when you refer to "child," what are you referring to?
10 A. Under the age of 18.
11 Q. Approximately how many victims of childhood sexual abuse have you evaluated and treated in your career?
12 A. I've treated hundreds upon hundreds of individuals who have
